head.title: CSS Introduction
head.description: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheet

data: CSS stands fro Cascading Style Sheet
CSS describes how THML elements are to be displayed on screen
CSS saves a lot of work. It can control the layout of multiple web all at once
External stylesheets are stored in CSS files
CSS is used to define style for your web pages, including the design, layout and variation in display for different devices and screen sizes.
HTML was NEVER intended to contain tags for formating a web page!
HTML was created to  describe the content of a web page, like:

When tags like <font>, and color attributes were added to the HTML 3.2 specification, it started a nightmare for web developers. Developement of large websites, where fonts and color information were added to every page, become a long and expensive process.
To solve this problem, the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C)created CSS.
CSS removed the style formating from the HTML page!

body.data: CSS Saves a Lot of Work!

data: The style definitions are normally saved in external .css files.
With an external stylesheet file, you can chage the look of an entire website by changing just on file!
